intro: Hibiscadelphus distans, commonly known as the Kauai waterwheel, is a rare endemic plant found exclusively on the island of Kauai in Hawaii. It is a member of the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its unique, spiraling arrangement of leaves and showy, five-petaled flowers. The plant thrives in moist, shaded habitats, often in areas with volcanic soil and high humidity. Due to habitat loss and invasive species, it is classified as critically endangered, making conservation efforts crucial for its survival. Its botanical features make it a subject of interest for both researchers and conservationists.
